title: Windsor Castle
aboutDescription: Very good to feel part of the UK history , very enjoyable day out. Changing of the guards is back but you need to check what days before booking tickets , must be in place by 10.30 to see. A new section has been added to cover the life and times of the Duke of Edinburgh it was very interesting and very informative about his life and service. St George's Chapel was the most moving part of the visit. Plenty of staff on hand to help , with great views from around the Castle.
thingsTodo: #1 of 44 things to do in Windsor

title: Windsor Lake
aboutDescription: I visited this lake on my way on what I thought would be literally be a good trip. And I enjoyed a lot of the natural lake moments, and it was a great experience.

title: Royal Windsor Taxis
aboutDescription: Very happy with my recent taxi pick up from Heathrow. The driver was prompt and I did not have to wait, despite my flight arriving early. Thank you very much Royal Windsor Taxis!

title: Shakespeare & Company
aboutDescription: Just attended the first performance in the New Spruce Theater (also my first time in the Berkshires). The outdoor theater is amazing. It was an unusually cold July evening, and the first preview of King Lear went over the expected three hours, but being able to enjoy live theater again was great!

title: Willow Court Farm & Poultry
aboutDescription: Our second trip to Willow Court Farm. We didn't think it was possible but enjoyed more than the first. Stayed for 2 nights in West Studio. The kids adored the bunk beds and we all slept well. Beautiful farm and we loved the new addition of the goats. We will be returning.

title: The Clark Art Institute
aboutDescription:
We were here about four years ago and were so impressed that we wanted to visit again. Tickets were ordered ahead of our arrival and we requested a wheel chair for one member of our party. The staff was very accommodating to our friend's needs.
The museum has a wide range of historical collections that are sure to delight visitors. The museum has a lovely cafeteria/cafe on the bottom floor which can be accessed by elevator.

title: Crane Museum of Papermaking
aboutDescription: What a great treat! We had a museum tour that was very educational and entertaining. We learned about how currency is made and how it has evolved over the years to resist counterfeiting. We also saw a demonstration of how linen paper is made, made our own stationery and took samples of them home.

title: Berkshire Brewing Company
aboutDescription: We stopped by for a beer as they are open outside now. It was great, music was starting up, beer was wonderful and we ordered bbq to go from the food truck. Staff were lovely, we will be back tomorrow for the new food truck and a beer. Cheers!

title: Windsor & Royal Borough Museum
aboutDescription: This is a small single room museum on the ground floor of the Windsor Guildhall building close to the Castle. Thereâ€™s a small entry fee of just Â£2, but itâ€™s well worth paying to see a fascinating collection of objects connected with the town and its long history. There are also useful information boards all round the room with photographs and explanations. Thereâ€™s an area in the centre with various things to keep children amused. Loved this tiny museum, which does a great job in a very limited space.

title: Alexandra Gardens
aboutDescription: It is well worth a wander through these gardens. They are very quiet at the moment and there is some lovely tree colour.

title: Windsor Royal Shopping
aboutDescription: Due to rain and wind I escaped to undercover shopping in the Windsor Royal Shopping Arcade. Plenty of high end names to please shopaholics and food/drink establishments. This place is usually bustling with life but not on this visit. Covid 19 has definitely hit hard and stopped the day trippers but I enjoyed the calm being able to browse in peace. Windsor Castle is right opposite the main entrance and hop on hop off bus tour stops there too. Windsor is a great place especially by the river.
